title: AT&T And DirecTV Mega-Merger Spells Changes For Media Landscape
teaser: AT&T's $49 billion acquisition of DirecTV now faces regulatory scrutiny. Meanwhile, a deal merging Comcast and Time Warner Cable is also in the works. Consumer advocates worry about consolidation, but many observers think the deals could hold down costs for the merged companies.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
